title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. No database/table/column information is displayed.
EB: The children nodes should be listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. The expected result is to have the new data source's database/table/column information displayed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Go to the data set editor's data source page.
3. Change the data source to a different one.

Actual result: No children node is listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. To verify, close the data set editor and reopen it.
